snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida are in all-out battle this weekend to tap into the billion-dollar donor network once harnessed by Mitt Romney.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie and former Florida Gov Jeb Bush have engaged in race to see who can claim support of donor network once allied to Mitt Romney, who has announced he will not run for president in 2016; battle for donors could result in one of the men bearing mantle of Republican Party's establishment into the race.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin and Michael Barbaro contributed reporting.Jonathan Martin and Michael Barbaro contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida are in all-out battle this weekend to tap into the billion-dollar donor network once harnessed by Mitt Romney.

headline.main: G.O.P. Campaigns Scramble to Add Romney Donors
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Campaigns Scramble to Add Romney Donors
